question: A 2 kg block rests on a frictionless incline that makes a 30° angle with the horizontal. What is the magnitude of the net force on the block?
solution: The net force on the block is the component of the block's weight parallel to the incline. The weight of the block is mg = (2 kg)(9.8 m/s^2) = 19.6 N. The component of the weight parallel to the incline is mgsin(θ), where θ is the angle the incline makes with the horizontal. Thus, the net force is (19.6 N)sin(30°) = 9.8 N. Since there is no friction, this is the only force acting on the block parallel to the incline, and therefore it is the net force.
